description: Published report of phyloinformatics hackathon entitled q(The 2006 NESCent Phyloinformatics Hackathon: A Field Report)
comment: This publication was authored by 24 participants in the months following the hackathon.  Cited by 16 as of 20 Nov 2015.

product_name: Comparative Methods in R hackathon poster
description: A nicely produced poster describing the rationale, activities, and outcomes of the comparative methods in R hackathon.
comment: Presented at the subsequent Evolution (ESA) conference

description: Tutorials and overview of available analyses and packages from the hackathon have been placed on a public website for all to use and improve.
comment: No longer actively updated.  Old docs say it  had >7,000 page visits from >30 countries and >600 edits since it went live in March 2008

description: Email list for a special interest group on the topic of comparative methods in R
comment: Continues to be used (as of March, 2015) with ~1000 subscribers and dozens of monthly messages

description: Blog entitled q(BEACON Researchers at Work: Phylotastic!) from the BEACON Center for the Study of Evolution in Action.
comment: The blog was written by participant Emily Jane McTavish.

product_name: Grant proposal to build a system based on phylotastic.
description: Collaborative NSF grant proposal entitled q(An open infrastructure to disseminate phylogenetic knowledge) submitted by 3 hackathon participants.
comment: Recommended for funding (3 years, $800K) by NSF (ABI) as of Feb, 2015.

description: Stand-alone server with several kinds of live software demonstrations, screencasts, and project information
Stand-alone publication entitled q(Phylotastic! Making tree-of-life knowledge accessible, reusable and convenient) describing the Phylotastic prototype service as a software development project.
comment: This publication, which focused on the software (not the hackathon), was authored by 28 participants in the months following the hackathon.  Cited by 6 as of 20 Nov, 2015

description: A series of 3 blogs describing and demonstrating products from the hackathon.
comment: The blogs include code examples and embedded screencasts.

product_name: Tree and data plotting in the phylobase project
description: A Google Summer-of-Encode project based on work at the hackathon
comment: The student (Peter Cowan) was still posting about this on r-sig-phylo in mid-2010 (http://markmail.org/message/wbeyt2i2zdv3dgs3), and is listed as an author on the picante paper (http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/26/11/1463.full)

product_name: Enhancing the representation of ecophylogenetic tools in R in the picante project
description: A Google Summer-of-Encode project based on work at the hackathon
comment: The student (Matthew Helmus) is listed as an author on the picante paper (http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/26/11/1463.full)

product_name: Summer course session on R for phylogenetics
description: A course section on R for phylogenetics taught by hackathon participant Marguerite Butler
comment: In later versions, this material became part of the evolutionary quantitative genetics workshop taught by Felsenstein and Arnold, which was primarily in R (e.g., https://academy.nescent.org/wiki/EQG_2013_Course_Materials).

description: This "task view" is a guide to R packages in the area of comparative methods.  It breaks the topic down into about 20 sections (e.g., ancestral state reconstruction, phyloclimatic modeling, etc) and links to 77 packages.
comment: Started at hackathon, maintained by Brian O'Meara (https://r-forge.r-project.org/scm/viewvc.php/pkg/inst/ctv/Phylogenetics.ctv?view=markup&root=ctv&pathrev=2094).

product_name: Towards an interoperating ecosystem of resources and tools for population genetics in R
description: Poster describing the rationale for the event, and the results of each team.
comment: Presented at the 2015 ISMB meeting.  30 views and 6 downloads as of 20 Nov 2015

product_name: Making the tree of life Phylotastic
description: Presentation delivered at 2012 iEvoBio meeting by Karen Cranston
Series of 5 blogs written during the event.
